title: Ok to use Futura Apostrophe?
content:
So when I was studying in college, I once had some art director who was a special guest to my class get mad at me because I used dumb quotes (or a dumb apostrophe; whatever it’s called) in my design. From then on I’m always careful to try to make the right choice. Anyways, I’m doing a design for the community college and they use Futura Bold Condensed on a lot of their publications, so I thought I would use it as well, but the apostrophe is not curly. Would this be a safe decision?

author: cosmorphis

comments.content: Yes. Futura is geometric, so the straight quotes are part of the design. Be sure to check that they’re slanted and thicker in one end than the other.
That’s what I was thinking. It looks like a prime, and is not quite straight up and down like a dumb, so I just wanted to get a second opinion.
